message: cool
Right now I just kind of write a little script to stress test it
i wish i was kidding
yeah, faking steps along the way isn't too hard, but i've never seen what real-world usage would actually be to fake the right things
(I have been using tab completion to type your name, and blown away that I both expected that to work, and that it *did*.)
it = Convore
ours was "EVERYONE IN THE BUILDING. START USING THIS THING"
Measuring the durability of a connection / number of disconnects, number of concurrent connections the server can sustain, something else...?
Tough to do
@ericflo That's similar to a couple tools we've put together internally to stress our Android messaging servers.
(Pretty soon it'll be changing to autocomplete to the last person who @-replied you, but often those are the same)
@alex What doesn't?
you and holscher are screwing this up!
Right on - yeah, most of those operate at the socket level, but the concept is similar.
@cscotta Only you guys have been at it for longer than I have, and have more engineers, and are probably all smarter than me :D
If anyone finds something, please let me know
@ericflo What kind of stress testing are you looking to do?
@cscotta If 500 people are on Convore at once all long polling at the same time, will it break? If not, will latency be so bad that messages take forever to stream in?
I basically want to simulate 500 people using the site
@cscotta Yeah, we have very similar problems I think
@ericflo How's your monitoring btw?
Protip: hitting @ and then hitting tab autocompletes to the last person you @-replied
etc.
@ericflo tab completion
@alex Decent.
@ericflo it doesn't let me scroll back through my history though, it'd be cool if it did
Like if I type @<tab> it shows the last person @<tab><tab> second to last
@alex Ahh, interesting
yeah
